name: 健身運動心理學研究
goals: To acquire professional knowledge of exercise psychology
To Improve the abilities to read academic journal paper and express professional knowledge
syllabus:
Course details

The course will conduct as 16+2 weeks (the detail for the "2", please see the end)

PEC0142 Studies in Exercise Psychology” is a graduate level course of exercise psychology that emphasizes exercise consequence, antecedents, model, and recommendation. The primary issue of the course provides the foundation for further research and implication, includes: a) the consequence and antecedents of exercise; b) theory and model of exercise.

Teaching schedule and theme

Week 1: Course introduction

Week 2: Introduction of Exercise Psychology

Week 3: Exercise Recommendation from International Perspectives

Week 4: Exercise and Cognitive Function

Week 5: Exercise and Stress

Week 6: Exercise and Anxiety

Week 7: Exercise and Depression

Week 8: Exercise and Emotion

Week 9: Exercise and Quality of Life

Week 10: Mid-term

Week 11: Exercise Behavior Theory and Model I

Week 12: Exercise Behavior Theory and Model II

Week 13: Developing Exercise Intervention I

Week 14: Developing Exercise Intervention II

Week 15: Review of New Trend

Week 16: Final exam (individual)

Week 16+1: Essay I

Week 16+2: Essay II
prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
